channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The 93rd Academy Awards will now be held April 25, 2021, eight weeks later than originally planned because of the pandemic's effects on the movie industry.
item.title: Academy delays 2021 Oscars ceremony because of coronavirus

item.description: The Food and Drug Administration said the drugs hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine were unlikely to be effective in treating the coronavirus.
item.title: US revokes emergency use of malaria drugs to treat coronavirus

item.description: China has halted imports from European salmon suppliers amid fears they might be linked to a coronavirus outbreak at a Beijing market, although experts say the fish itself is unlikely to carry the disease.
item.title: China halts European salmon imports over suspected link to coronavirus outbreak

item.description: The kidnapping attempt failed after He Xiangjian's son escaped and swam across a lake to raise the alarm, according to reports.
item.title: Kidnapping of Chinese billionaire thwarted by police

item.description: The US Supreme Court has ruled that a landmark civil rights law protects LGBT people from discrimination in employment.
item.title: Top US court backs protection for LGBT workers

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The government's clean energy investment agency has taken a $3.5 million stake in Australian company Jet Charge to help it roll out charging stations aimed at lowering power costs for electric vehicle owners.
item.title: CEFC invests $3.5m in electric vehicle charging station company

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: High-flying Parramatta are keeping their feet on the ground as they look to go 6-0 for the season - something the class of 1986 could not achieve.
item.title: Eels won't be distracted by the hype, says Arthur

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Leslie Janusz Hooker and the team inside LJ Hooker have done their best to downplay a decision last week to appoint KPMG administrators to a slew of the businesses entities.
item.title: Big renovation on the quiet as LJ Hooker calls in administrators

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: The NSW government will spend an extra $388 million to get thousands of elective surgery patients into operating theatres faster after COVID-19 restrictions delayed their procedures.
item.title: NSW government funds elective surgery blitz

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Sydneysiders will pay less for their water from next month but face a price leap next time a dry spell hits, according to new usage charges.
item.title: Sydney residents to pay less for water until next drought hits

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The federal government has cancelled more than $1.2 billion in loans to VET students.
item.title: Government cancels more than $1.2 billion in VET student loans

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: No political party in Australia is immune to branch stacking, bullying and harassment.
item.title: 'Bullies are forgiven, rewarded, reinstated': The toxic pattern in Australian politics

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Petrol giant Ampol is partnering with electric vehicle charging network Evie to integrate charging stations into petrol stations.
item.title: Evie, Ampol tie-up could turbocharge electric vehicle uptake

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: There are some laws that can never be ignored - Newton's third law of physics for example.
item.title: In Xi Jinping's effort to make China No. 1, he's forgotten the basics

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The world's largest investment manager and a top super fund are facing pressure to explain investments in a Chinese miner set to destroy ancient artefacts.
item.title: Investors face pressure over miner set to destroy Aboriginal artefacts

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Martins Noel Keyen was due to return to Nigeria on the day he experienced a mental health episode in Sydney's north and stabbed a police officer.
item.title: Student who stabbed policeman in Sydney's north traumatised by incident

item.description: Attacking statues is less about tearing down past achievements and more about ensuring that inhumane deeds of the past are not honoured into the future.
item.title: Statue of limitations: monuments still a slap in the face

item.description: Education in the 21st century has to be about more than academic achievement and that's where compulsory community service comes in.
item.title: I'm trying to ace my HSC but I see the value in volunteering

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: A new financial index shows how some suburbs escaped the coronavirus pandemic's economic fallout, but others did not.
item.title: Data tells the story of how Brisbane's finances were hit by the pandemic

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: As we face a future where working remotely could become our new normal, now is probably the time to invest in lifting your home office.
item.title: Give your home office a glow up with these simple ideas

item.description: 100 years ago today, a "salvo of cheers rang out from every point" as the much-loved Prince of Wales, Edward VIII, arrived at Farm Cove, Sydney Harbour.
item.title: From the Archives, 1920: Sydney greets Prince Edward VIII

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Supper for the fallen, Rabbit extermination, Railway to the city
item.title: In the Herald: June 16, 1888

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The Somyurek scandal leaves the Premier and his party facing many questions.
item.title: The big questions facing Daniel Andrews and Labor

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: While the NSW government has scrapped 50-person limits in venues from July 1, the gigs are far from back.
item.title: Four square metres a massive gulf for theatres, venues

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The ALP's problems run deeper than Adem Somyurek, party elders warn.
item.title: Victorian ALP urged to root out corruption, examine culture

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: There are growing fears owners of $2b worth of unsecured Virgin bonds will walk away empty handed unless administrators cut the amount owed to aircraft lessors.
item.title: Virgin bondholders pin hopes on administrators revaluing aircraft debt

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 16, 2020

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, June 16

item.dc:creator: Nick McKenzie
item.description: One minister has built an army of fake members to wield enormous power over the Andrews government
item.title: ‘F**k the premier’: Labor’s secret tapes reveal industrial scale stackathon

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Some students beginning their exams say they are stressed at the additional pressures of managing exams with monitoring software.
item.title: UQ students complain about exam monitoring software

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Treasurer Dominic Perrotett will deliver the first economic update to Parliament since pandemic.
item.title: NSW unemployment hits almost 8 per cent as the COVID recovery starts

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The match may have happened 27 hours late but it was worth the wait for the Roosters, who played supporting act to James Tedesco's brilliance.
item.title: Roosters beat Monday blues as Tedesco makes light work of Bulldogs

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Damian Drum is pushing the Morrison government to force the Victorian government to build a rail tunnel into the Melbourne CBD.
item.title: Rejecting tunnel for Melbourne airport rail link would be 'short-sighted': Nationals MP

item.description: Searching for the remaining three corners of the Earth.
item.title: Jolene's emerald green eyes hit a bull's-eye

item.description: The decision by the UN Human Rights Council followed a request last week by Burkina Faso on behalf of African countries, it said in a statement on Monday.
item.title: UN rights body to examine 'systemic' US racism and police brutality

item.description: The F-15C Eagle from the 48th Fighter Wing was on a routine training mission from RAF Lakenheath when it crashed. The cause wasn't immediately clear and the status of the pilot is unknown.
item.title: US Air Force plane crashes into North Sea

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: A new podcast from actor Miranda Tapsell and writer/actor Nakkiah Lui explores race, resistance and girl power through the prism of the debutante ball.
item.title: Outdated or empowering: is there still a place for debutante balls?

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Premier announces Essendon MP will take on Adem Somyurek's portfolio, then discovers government had already reached constitutional limit of 17 ministers from lower house.
item.title: Somyurek scandal claims another scalp

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Plans to fast-track two dams in NSW have prompted calls for Federal Environment Minister Sussan Ley to step in to apply biodiversity protection laws.
item.title: Fears two NSW dam projects will ignore economic, financial safeguards

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The PM wants to speed up approvals for major works, a plan met with claims it will damage the environment, and accusations his government let approval times blow out.
item.title: Fears over Morrison's plan for 'single touch' environmental approvals

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Jordan Springs Public School is the first of five schools completed under a state government pilot program in which 95 per cent of the school is built in factories off-site.
item.title: 'Trailblazer' Sydney school assembled in months with new technique

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: In ordinary circumstances Manchester City would have long since relinquished their Premier League crown to Liverpool.
item.title: Arsenal readies to 'surprise' City in competition restart

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: Labor has accused the government of lying to the public in a bid to pursue cuts to the postal service.
item.title: Labor reviving 'Mediscare' tactics with Australia Post campaign, government says

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: In March, the Sharks welcomed Dino Mezzatesta as their third CEO in 12 months.
item.title: 'A lot of changeover': Gallen says instability at top affecting Sharks on pitch

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Councillor Stephen Jolly will put the plaque up for debate in an amendment to a motion from Greens Councillor Amanda Stone.
item.title: Yarra Council to consider consulting with the Aboriginal community on Captain Cook statue

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Rugby administrators are desperate to see crowds in stadiums - starting with the Queensland Reds' blockbuster with the Waratahs on July 3.
item.title: Horan urges Queensland to allow crowds for Super Rugby opener

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: Branch stacking is as old as politics in Australia, but as we now know, it has grown ever more toxic.
item.title: Bring out your dead: tales from the branch-stacking front

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: An unusual Tudor Revival home in Brighton designed by journalist Esme Johnston in the 1920s has won a reprieve after an application to demolish it and build two townhouses was refused.
item.title: Esme Johnston home saved from demolition

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The announcement of 12 new cases of COVID-19 in Victoria on Monday - including a second Black Lives Matter protester - has tempered hopes of the MCG being a quarter-full by July.
item.title: New coronavirus cases temper immediate push for crowds
